result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcus P. Riley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Marcus P. Riley is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Marcus P. Riley was found guilty of Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
*  Pay fine of $2,000.00 and court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*  Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
Spend 12 months in the county jail, comm forthwith.  Credit for 5 days served.  Huber allowed upon completion of the Living Free Program.  May not have contact with Kelly Hastreiter, Selmer Phillips, or Dominique Davis, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

timeConds.notes: TO COMMENCE FORTHWITH.  Huber privileges are allowed upon completion of Living Free Program.  No ELM without a court hearing.  Credit for 5 days served.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marcus P. Riley

records.addlTxt: NOH sent to deft  Returned from the United Postal Service.  Return to sender.  Attempted, not known.  Unable to forward.
Bond applied; partial refund.  kk/cp  ck# 15CH073482
No ELM during conditional jail sentence without a court hearing.  kmk
Ct.2 -Dismissed  kmk
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney K Watson.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court imposes and stays a total sentence of 3 1/2 years WSP; 18 months initial confinement; 2 years extended supervision w/conditions; deft is eligible for SAP and CIP; deft placed on probation for 3 years w/conditions; 1 year conditional jail, Huber allowed upon completion of the living free program; no ELM without a court hearing; deft taken into custody from court; credit for 5 days served; $2,000 fine plus costs, deft to submit DNA sample and pay $250 DNA surcharge; bond applied to costs, any remainder of bond to be returned to poster.
Sentencing hearing on January 8, 2015 at 09:00 am.

With Atty Watson, and by approval of the court, the SEH of 11/24/14 at 11am is rescheduled, as the DOC Agt assigned to complete the PSI will be on leave and another agent will need time to complete; reset to 1/8/15 at 9:00am.
